ul.li: The Gentoo Linux FAQ answers Gentoo Linux frequently-asked questions.
The Gentoo Linux CD Installation Guide explains how to install Gentoo Linux using our installation CD.
The Portage User Guide explains how to start using our ports system called Portage.
The Desktop Configuration Guide shows you how to set up a fully-functional desktop system after installation.
The OpenAFS Guide guides you through the process of getting OpenAFS configured on your system. OpenAFS is a distributed network-based file sharing technology.
The Developers HOWTO gives you the information you need to get started creating your own ports (ebuilds).
The CVS tutorial will be of assistance if you are new to CVS, the concurrent versions system.
The Documentation Guide will introduce you to the XML syntax used for the creation of our Web documentation.
Contributing ebuilds will show you how to use Bugzilla to submit new Gentoo Linux ebuilds that you have created.

body.p: Daniel Robbins, the Chief Architect of Gentoo Linux, is also a regular columnist for the IBM developerWorks Linux Zone. The following sections contain a index of Daniel's most recent content.

In the Advanced Filesystem Implementor's Guide series, Daniel takes a look at many of the new filesystems available under Linux 2.4, including ReiserFS, ext3, XFS, devfs and tmpfs. Topics include:
the benefits of journalling and ReiserFS (Part 1)
setting up a ReiserFS system (Part 2)
using the tmpfs virtual memory filesystem and bind mounts (Part 3)
the benefits of devfs, the device management filesystem (Part 4)
beginning the conversion to devfs (Part 5)
completing the conversion to devfs using an init wrapper (Part 6)
the benefits of the ext3 filesystem (Part 7)
an in-depth look at ext3 and the latest kernel updates (Part 8)
XFS part 1 (soon!)
XFS part 2
